alert.note: Alert for Fairfield (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 19 at 6:33PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following area, Fairfield. * WHEN...Until 830 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 631 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This may cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible over the area in the next hour or so. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Winnsboro, Fairfield County Airport, Ridgeway, Winnsboro Mills and Rion. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 77 between mile markers 32 and 46. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
